page.title: 17 - CHURCHES IN THE AREA (2)
page.content: In the grounds of St. Michael's School, Burton Park is Burton Church. It is the smallest complete church in Sussex and has a norman font. The herringbone masonary is 800 years old and the screen has stood since the 15th century. There is a monument to Sir John Goring of 1520, a former owner of Burton Park House, together with a brass of Lady Elizabeth Goring (died 1558) who is wearing over her dress an ornate coat covered with heraldic designs. St. Agatha's at Coates was built in 1100, with alterations in the 13th century. It has a plain Norman Chancel arch, a norman window in the nave and a norman font. The timbered porch was added in the 16th century. The rector is Rev. Ronald Johnson from Sutton Rectory, services are held at 8:00 am or 11:15 am on Sundays.
